reviews.text: We have just returned from an eventful stay in Disneyland Paris Park and Hotel! To say the leaset!We started off our stay at the FABULOUS Disneyland Hotel and after a walk around the fantasic, majical Park with our 2 children aged 3 and 7 years we returned to the hotel to check in at 3.00 to be told we had been upgraded to the castle club WOW! The VIP service we received there was fantastic and sOOO friendly were the staff in the whole hotel! I had read reviews about the rooms being small but to me they were just as big as any other hotel room I have stayed in but more beautiful as Disney does! Also some people had written reviews about Disney being really expensive the only thing I saw that was pricey was the mini bar which you should avoid or you will pay 5.00 euro a bottle of water! Apart from that we ate in Mcdonalds as a treat for kids 25.00euro for burgers fries drinks deserts ect. for 4 which you would pay more for in Irelands McDonald's to be quite honest. Planet Hollywood great food but do request a time that morning at conceriage so you don't have to wait long , a meal there 4 main courses(2 adults, 2 children's meals) 1 beer ,1 wine which(in disney is very smallglasses of wine) and 2 deserts(children) 61 euro fine! We booked and pre-payed a food voucher before we left I would not do that again as if you don't make the booking for a specific disney resturant you will lose your money it is better to go and then see as you have SOOO much choice for food there and I thought the food was exceptional as was all of Disney! Our children actually got a virus going over and the help we had from the staff in the Disneyland Hotel was exceptional to say the least organising a doctor ,to cleaning our room whenever requested! I would not be able to fault the staff or service in this hotel at all. Thank you Disney we will be back soon and can't wait!!!!
reviews.title: Most majical place!!

likes.liked: — The quality of service and accomadation

reviews.text: Like some people, we had read a few poor reviews of the hotel and were a bit downbeat before going. However it was fantastic.
reviews.title: tiggertastic

reviews.text: We flew from glasgow with a 3 year old and baby of 8mths. Booked transfer witha company called tt-prestige who were great. We were greeted very warmly by the reception staff and made a fuss of the baby and 3 year old. All paperwork dealt with v efficiently, and room ready. Rooms ok - starting to show their age - but you dont spend much time there anyway. In saying that we all felt very comfortable. There is no fridge or tea/ coffee maker. TV has english disney channel. The hotel puts on a show of the characters at 4pm in the reception - if you have small kids dont miss it. Good photo op and autographs. We had booked several lunch and dinners before arrival (staying for 5 days). I would definately BOOK IN ADVANCE if you want to eat in the hotel. I spoke to several people who were told to come back around 10 pm for their evening meal (with kids) because they had not booked. Ate in inventions buffet (food was good, and good choice, also offered oz wine - difficult to get in France, characters walk about and spent as long as you wanted with the kids). Also ate in Calfornian Grill - a bit more adult - but the kids were welcome - food good. The food is pricey - but that is hotel restaurants. We also ate in the village at cafe mickey - v. busy but good fun. The park closes at 7.30 so around that time there is a mad rush to queue for the restaurants. The location of the hotel is perfect for the park - 2 mins walk. There is also a baby shop ("buttons and bows" i think it was called) on your right as you go in to the park- which sells nappys, baby food etc. The shop in the hotel sells all disney stuff - with a cooler for diet coke, water and milk - but expensive - 2.50E for a diet coke. The spa/pool area was very good - quiet. Sauna/steam in each changing room and jacuzzi at pool area. All staff were v pleasant and did their best to make you feel welcome. We would definately stay here again. pip pip
reviews.title: Dream hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in disneyland hotel France for three nights.
reviews.title: Worth every single penny - fantastic stay

likes.liked: — Everything from the second we walked in I felt like royalty
likes.disliked: — Nothing to mention, could not fault one single thing

reviews.text: When we checked in after 20 minutes of standing around we were directed to our room on the 2nd floor.
reviews.title: Our daughter had a great time !

likes.disliked: — No coffee and tea facilities in the room

reviews.text: I have never written a review before but as we had such a fantastic 4 days at the Disneyalnd Hotel during Feb half term I felt I had to write. I booked the hotel on the strength of recommendations from this site and was not disappointed. We travelled with a 5 year old and 2 year old from St Pancras and on the train a disney employee came to our seats to hand us our park passes and luggage labels. At Marne la vallee we took our luggage to disney express and within 10 minutes we were at the park gates and 5 minutes after that having lunch outside on mainstreet - so very slick operation. At 3pm we went to the hotel and checked in. We had a lovely room on the first floor overlooking the eurostar station towards disney village. the room had 2 double beds, table and 2 chairs and a travel cot, wardrobe etc and still plenty of room for all of us. We loved the little touches like bathrobes and slippers and the lovely toilettres which were refreshed each day - our kids loved the coins on the pillows that appeared every evening which we said tinkerbell left! The buffet breakfast was amazing - so much food and excellent quality and we never had to wait for a table although we got later and later each morning! The disney characters in the foyer were great and meant we didn't have to stand around in the park waiting for photos. The 2 minute walk to the park gates was excellent as if were feeling cold or tired we could come back for a break. The hotel shop was good and sold water/soft drinks and some other essentials. In all we had a great time and can't wait to go again when the kids are older. I would also recommend going out of season as the longest we queued for a ride was 20 minutes so we went on favourite rides many times over the 4 days. It cost approx £1200 for the 4 days with eurostar so wasn't cheap but still think it was worth it!
reviews.title: Loved our trip!

reviews.text: THe holiday was pretty good - the theme parks were awesome but the hotel was only good. Dont get me wrong, i don't think I can fault it , I jsut expected so much more for the price. The price difference between this hotel and the others is astonishing - and we didn't even stay in the castle club. I somehow expected the rooms to be bigger and more luxurious, but there was nothing to really fault. There were cracked tiles in the bathroom - but i would never have noticed it if I wasnt having a soak, and its pretty normal. I just dont think that the room accommodation in itself deserves a above average rating as I have stayed in better that werent assosciated with theme parks or this kind of price.
reviews.title: pretty good
We had a lovely time
reviews.text: Unfortunately we went when it was FREEZING. (14-17th Feb) but it didnt stop us at having fun at all. We were two adults with 2 boys (aged 2 - went for his birthday and a 2 month old baby) My little boy Loves mickey mouse, but was a bit freaked out by the characters visiting him every meal!! They were ever so good though and left him alone - which worked well - and by the last day he was calling for them to come over!

There is one specifically important thing yo uneed to know when staying at any disney hotel - not only this one, and that is BOOK YOUR MEALS!! we didnt know this and spent our entire first night going from restaurant to restaurant trying to get availability before 10pm (it was 6pm when we were looking) and no one could fit us in - eventually I was in tears at Cafe mickey and a lovely girl got me in to the rainforest cafe. I was mortified at the fact that there is NOWHERE to get a meal unless you have booked I had kids to feed and I was starving! No one told us this before hand - they should tell you this in your hotel when you check in.
reviews.title: Not good value

likes.liked: — Staff friendly even in busy and difficult circumstances. Close to Park.
likes.disliked: — Part of the Disneyland monopoly, no tea and coffee facilities or fridge in room, not worth the high prices

reviews.text: You definitely have to eat the buffet in the inventions restaurant (erm, I think its that one - in the Disney hotel the only other one is the alacarte) its 49 euros per adult and worth every little cent!! It was amazing. On the last night we did it pretty much just for the orange crepes!! I think the service lacks a little in this restaurant though, but only from some lazy staff (the minority) However there was one asian man who was WONDERFUL - so you really never can tell. I think the grumpy people worked in teh morning buffets, but on our first morning the staff were so lovely. SO be prepared for a hit and miss. The food was on all occasions fantastic - brekkie and dinner.
reviews.title: Every child should come here atleast once!

reviews.text: After reading quite a few comments both good & bad on tripadvisor about the dineyland hotel i thought i would pen our fabulous experience of not only the hotel but also that of the exclusive castle club , after paying a quite substantial amount for a 3 nidht 4 day break (ouch)!!! , i was a bit concerned especially as i like sunny / beach holidays , but i went with the flow and after a bit of persuasion from the wife and our 6 year old i thought sod it , well i'm glad i did from the staff to the resort ,i cannot fault it , i have stayed in quite a few 5 star resorts but for location and elegance it is just fab , food in the inventions restaurant is brillant and the constant characters flowing through the hotel & restaurants for photo ops and signing is endless , when you upgrade to castle club you get your own private castle club lounge which is exclusive to castle club members only it comes with free soft drinks tea coffee , sandwiches and cakes during the day and private buffet breakfast away from the masses in the morning , one of the best bits though is the direct lift staight to the park turnstyles , if during your trip inside the park and the kiddies are getting tired you can pop back to your room at anytime have a break and a cup of tea and then crack on later it is that simple !! no transfer buses just call the lift which is activated by a credit card size keycard and within seconds you are up by your room or your private lounge if like me you could'nt justify the extra amount of £500 , i would say save up and go "cc" its worth every single penny , the look on my little girls face was priceless when mickie & minnie not only came into the restaurant on the first night but even started cutting up her food and fed her she was so excited , i did mention flow of characters the only one she did'nt meet in the castle club lounge was donald duck and by my reckoning that is quite a few characters and all in the peace and tranquility of your own hotel lounge no pushing and shoving she got to spend quality time with each character , i have absolutly no hesitation in recommending this hotel or resort it is first class all the way however it comes at a price but worth every single penny ,
reviews.title: REVIEW OF THE CASTLE CLUB AND DISNEYLAND HOTEL

reviews.text: This was our third stay here in three years and possibly our best so far as we came better prepared than before.
reviews.title: Third visit in three years

likes.liked: — The location right by the Disney Parks

reviews.text: Euro / sterling rates make it pricey but we drove again and took as much food as we could get in our cool box, along with our travel kettle and mugs so we didn't 'waste' money on teas,coffees, crisps, biscuits etc and room service.
reviews.title: Disneyland Hotel Paris
A good choice
reviews.text: We also avoid the mini bar which may be mini but has major prices!!
This year we had our coldest weather conditions to date and were really glad we were so close to the park so we could head back 'home' to warm up.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.text: We recently spent 2 nights at the Disneyland Hotel at Euro Disney with our 3.5 yr old daughter. The hotel is great in terms of its location and the characters that frequent the hotel during the day and at meal times. The accomodation is good, a little tired in places and in need of a redecoration but the atmosphere is great. The swimming pool and changing facilities are not great and are not linked so you do find yourself walking through the pool and gym reception wrapped in your towel!
reviews.title: Great hotel but be awaer of a few things!

likes.liked: — It really is a pink palace!
likes.disliked: — In need of a re decoration and the need to book everything well in advance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing that we werent aware of is the need to book the HOTEL'S restaurants before you go. When we arrived (midday) we asked for a table that evening and were told by the concierge that we should have booked in advance and that we could not get a table until 10pm. Clearly with a 3 year old that was not good! We went to the restaurant directly and did mange to get a table at 7.30pm. Booking up early and in advance seems to be the key for most things.
reviews.title: Magical and a truly great experience, highly recommend

likes.liked: — beds being turned down , a great suprise

reviews.text: One of the real benefits is that as the hotel is right at the Park gates it does enable you to make full use of the early opening times for guests of the hotels. We were in at 8am went on all the rides that were open at least 2 or 3 times without a queue!!
reviews.title: good time had buy all

reviews.text: It is a great place to go and I would recommend paying more for this hotel if you have young children. There is no way we would have seen all the characters that we did if we hadnt stayed at the Disneyland. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Overpriced, over hyped and lacks Disney Magic

reviews.text: After staying 4 nights in a hotel from hell we moved to the Disney;adn Hotel where we faced lovely staff, great surroundings and just perfect.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Disneyland Hotel

reviews.text: As DVC members and because I was pregnant at the time we decided to spend our points and go to the disneyland hotel, Paris. The points that it cost for 2 nights there was the equivalent of a week at Animal Kingdom Lodge, Florida.
reviews.title: We expected more

reviews.text: This is the second time that we have been to Disneyland Paris, the first time we stayed at Santa Fe as this was before we joined DVC.
reviews.title: Back for the 7th year and it just gets better!

likes.liked: — location and convenience - can't be beaten

reviews.text: The hotel itself is gorgeous, victorian style right on the gates of disney land park. The lobby is stunning, the rooms are very large. It was great to be able to just exit the hotel and go into the park.
reviews.title: worth the money for the convenient location

likes.liked: — Location to park and meeting the characters

reviews.text: I managed to contract a chest infection before we got there so only spent a small amount of time in the park. However I did go to the pool. This was small but serviceable.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.text: There were a number of issues that we had with the hotel.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: Stayed at The castle Club room at Disney. Well worth the extra money, wouldnt stay at Disney now at any other hotel.
reviews.title: Disney Hotel Castle Club Room

reviews.text: The staff cant do enough for you and the VIP fastpass is a MUST as is the private lift into the park.
reviews.title: Reliable Disneyland hotel

reviews.text: Absolutly BRILLIANT
reviews.title: Had a fantastic time! if you can - stay here!

reviews.text: Family visit - 2adults + 2 children (7+9)
reviews.title: Pleasant

reviews.text: Third stay and still the best.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

likes.liked: — It being right at the park gates
likes.disliked: — Can't think of a single thing!

reviews.text: Such a great stay, we stayed in this hotel in September 2007 for a week. We booked via a Travel Agent and got the 4 nights for the price of 3. Like others have advised we paid the extra £200 to get the "Castle Club" and this was well worth the money. Simply for one reason, No Queues for anything in the hotel... Having your own restaurant, better accomodation, lift to the park, fastpass, one-to-one access to the disney characters made the holiday very special. Couldn't help feeling a little smug every morning looking over the Castle Club balcony onto the people queuing to get into the hotel restaurant who hadn't upgraded to Castle Club. We were fortunate to have a room looking right down main street and on to the Disney castle, the people in the hotel were very helpful and spoke multiple languages. Overall a magical experience and I miss the addictive (but not at all anoying) disney music that follows you everywhere you go! Only thing that was strange is the small size of the pool, but we used it once and it was fine - especially like the life guard who provides free floatation aids for you and your children should you need them.
reviews.title: Magical, relaxed experience.

likes.liked: — The best hotel in the park!

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located at the entrance of the Disneyland Park in Fantasia Gardens which are immaculately maintained given that it is the main thoroughfare for visitors to the park. The reception area is extremely impressive, and certainly has the "wow " factor with the perfect christmas decorations. The hotel is clean even to the extent that the flower pots are washed daily. We booked a standard room situated in the west wing from where we had a partial view of the stunning Sleeping Beauty's Castle, and the Main Street Christmas Tree. The room was plush and by far the largest I have ever stayed in. It contained two double beds, a sofa bed, a television cabinet, a table and chairs, a writing desk and a large built in wardrobe with shelving, wooden coat hangers and a safe. On the table was a vase of fresh roses and a 15th Anniversary mug containing sweets, which my three year old daughter believed was from Tinkerbell! The bathroom was equally impressive. The bed linen and towels were changed daily and a turn down service was provided, with chocolate coins left as an added bonus.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: There is a mini bar, but unfortunately no tea or coffee making facilities. Dressing gowns and slippers are also provided.
reviews.title: Treat yourself

reviews.text: The breakfast selection was more than satisfactory, my only criticism being that the tea and coffee is left in a thermos on the table and unless you request otherwise you have the remaining ones from the previous guests which is out of character with the rest of te experience. In general the staff were very helpful and attentive. Cafe Fantasia Bar is tastefully decorated and is a perfect place to relax in the evenings, to the sound of the pianist, (plays Disney songs, musical theatre, classical and seasonal)although a little expensive. The hotel shop is large and holds a wide stock. It is open until midnight and charges the same price as shops in the Park itself. The staff here were more than helpful and seemed genuinely happy.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay!

reviews.text: The opportunities to "Meet and Greet " Disney characters is endless as they visit and spend time with hotel guests at breakfast and in the evening, apart from the Disney Princesses who only appear at the Parades. Consequently we booked lunch with Suzy and Perla at L'Auberge De Cendrillon in Fantasyland where my daughter received a birthday cake from Cinderella and Prince Charming. This was a fantastic experience and the menu superb
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: After our success with this hotel last year we did not have to put too much thought into where to stay for this years trip to Disneyland Paris. We arrived on the 7th january for three nights and imagine our surprise to see the hotel still decorated in all its Christmas finery - it was such a beautiful sight. We got checked in very quickly even though it was busy at the reception - extra staff appeared from the offices behind the counter! We got a beautiful spacious room on the fourth floor with views out over the pool and surrounding garden, the room was spotless and seemed to be very well equiped and maintained. Breakfast each day was as yummy as last year with plenty of choices across the board - we were delighted that tea and coffee was left in pots on your table - this was a small gripe last year - great to see they notice customer comments! The room was cleaned throughly each day and the turndown service with chocolate coins left on your pillow is still there. The swimming pool was open this year and our family had a swim each night after the parks closed and before dinner, others have commented that the pool is small but we found it fine and the temp was great. Kids were allowed to use the jacuzzi which my two girls were delighted with! We ate dinner in Inventions and it was as good as we had remembered with lots of fresh seafood and other great choices e.g. quaill and wild mushroom (yum) pork in apple cider sauce, beef fillet and a few different chicken dishes. The kids found lots to suit their taste too - pizza, fish fillets, chicken drumsticks, lasagne and spagetti bolognese. There were lots of characters coming to the table and they stayed chatting to the girls for as long as they wanted. We found the lounge a very restful place to go during the day between changes in parks - we had a hot drink and warmed up! Immediately after leaving the Park in the evening we had a cocktail each night which was a lovely way to unwind before our swim. The staff seemed even more attentive this year with lots of smiles and hellos. All in all we had a wonderful relaxing few days and while I know we wont be there next year I hope to return in 2010!!
reviews.title: Another Fantastic Few Nights at the Disneyland Hotel

likes.liked: — Roomy comfortable beds, closeness to the Parks
likes.disliked: — No tea coffee making facilities - but brought own travel kettle

reviews.text: At over £200 per night i wondered if i was throwing money down the drain - i am happy to say it was worth every penny.
reviews.title: Best weekend ever

reviews.text: We traveled for a weekend and arrived late on friday night - the hotel looked great from the outside and out little girl (aged 6) was very impressed. Inside the staf couldn't be nicer and more helpful.
reviews.title: Simply Superb

reviews.text: Breakfast in the morning was a great surprise - the food was consitently good and there were disney characters everywhere. The shop was open late which helped as we didn't have to waste time during the park hours; but you never feel they are pushing you to buy stuff (although we did buy loads).
reviews.title: magical hotel

reviews.text: The park was very good and we had a great time overall.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay!
